00070 class NIFLoader : Ogre::ManualResourceLoader

00080                                     const std::string &group="General");

00114         //returns the skeleton name of this mesh
00115         std::string getSkeletonName()
00116         {
00117             return resourceName + ".skel";
00118         }
00119 
00120         // This is the interface to the Ogre resource system. It allows us to
00121         // load NIFs from BSAs, in the file system and in any other place we
00122         // tell Ogre to look (eg. in zip or rar files.) It's also used to
00123         // check for the existence of texture files, so we can exchange the
00124         // extension from .tga to .dds if the texture is missing.
00125         Mangle::VFS::OgreVFS *vfs;
00126

00135         int numbers;
00136         int stack;
00137         std::multimap<std::string,std::string> MaterialMap;
00138 
00139         // pointer to the ogre mesh which is currently build
00140         Ogre::Mesh *mesh;
